Package com.w10.risk_game.utils

Class MapDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w10.risk_game.utils.MapDisplay
  • public class MapDisplay
extends Object
    The MapDisplay class is responsible for displaying the game map, including continent and country information, and optionally showing the number of armies in each country.
    Author:
    Sherwyn Dsouza

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayMap​(GameMap p_map, boolean p_showArmies)
      The `displayMap` function takes a `GameMap` object and a boolean flag as parameters, and prints a formatted table displaying information about the continents, countries, and their neighbors in the map.

    • Method Detail

      • displayMap

        public void displayMap​(GameMap p_map,
                       boolean p_showArmies)
        The `displayMap` function takes a `GameMap` object and a boolean flag as parameters, and prints a formatted table displaying information about the continents, countries, and their neighbors in the map.
        Parameters:
        p_map - The `p_map` parameter is an instance of the `GameMap` class, which represents the game map containing continents, countries, and their connections.
        p_showArmies - The parameter `p_showArmies` is a boolean value that determines whether to display the number of armies in each country or not. If `p_showArmies` is `true`, the number of armies will be displayed. If `p_showArmies` is `false`, the number of
